article.title: Lockheed Martin to Integrate LCS Remote Minehunting System
article.author: George I. Seffers
article.text: Lockheed Martin Corp., Riviera Beach, Fla., is being awarded a $12,166,247 cost-plus-fixed-fee delivery order under previously awarded basic ordering agreement to perform maintenance, testing and integration of the Remote Minehunting System with Littoral Combat Ship (LCS) mission modules and LCS seaframe programs. The Naval Sea Systems Command, Washington, D.C., is the contracting activity.
